intro: Wikstroemia alternifolia, commonly known as the alternateleaf sandarac, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its narrow, alternate leaves and clusters of small, fragrant yellow flowers. The plant produces a resinous sap that has been historically used in traditional medicine and as a varnish. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
